newsitem.title: JAPAN: New South Wales launches 5.8% yen/A$ samurai bonds.
newsitem.headline: New South Wales launches 5.8% yen/A$ samurai bonds.

text.p: Australia's New South Wales Treasury Corp launched on Thursday 20 billion yen worth of 5.8 percent yen/Australian dollar dual currency samurai bonds due October 7, 1999, lead manager Daiwa Securities said.
The bonds are priced at par and they are guaranteed by the state of New South Wales.
Holders of the samurai bonds will receive A$5,807.20 for each 500,000-yen bond held at maturity.
The coupon will be paid in yen, while redemption will be in Australian dollars.
The breakdown of the terms is as follows:
AMT 20 bln yen COUPON 5.8% MATURITY Oct 7, 1999
TYPE yen/A$ samurai ISS PRICE 100 PAY DATE Oct 8, 1996
SIGN DATE Oct 8 SUB PERIOD Sept 25 to Oct 7
NOTES: Syndicate members are Daiwa Securities, Nikko Securities, Nomura Securities, Yamaichi Securities and Hinode Securities.
